===Etymology===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Black}}
[[File:Solid_black.svg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|黒}} (''kuro''): the colour '''[[black]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|くろ|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=くろ}}. Via root [[morpheme]] ''*kur'', cognate with ''kuri'' ({{l|ja|涅}}, "black [[mud]] from the [[bed]] of a body of water"),<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> noun ''kura'' ({{l|ja|暗}}, "darkness; deception"; {{l|ja|蔵}}, {{l|ja|倉}}, {{l|ja|庫}} "[dark] storehouse") > adjective ''kurai'' ({{l|ja|暗い}}, "dark"), verb ''kuru'' > ''kureru'' ({{l|ja|暮れる}}, "to become dark; to near the end [of a day, of a year, of a life]"; {{l|ja|暗れる}}, {{l|ja|眩れる}}, "to become depressed, to become dreary of mood"). Compare Proto-Turkic {{m|trk-pro|*kara||black}}, {{cog|mn|хар|tr=khar||black}}.

Possibly cognate with {{cog|ko|구름||cloud}}; compare also {{cog|ja|雲|tr=kumo||cloud}} and {{etyl|ko|-}} *{{m|ko||검|black}}, root [[morpheme]] of {{m|ko|검다||to be black|pos=ve&#8203;rb}}, {{m|ko|검은||black|pos=adjective}}.

# {{lb|ja|sort=くろ|accounting}} short for {{m|ja|黒字|tr=kuroji}}: {{m|en|black}} as an [[accounting]] term, indicating a [[profit]]

# [[guilt]]; the [[guilty]] one, the guilty [[party]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=くろ|slang}} [[anarchy]] as a [[belief system]] or [[philosophy]]; an [[anarchist]]
